item.title: All Grow A Garden Cosmetics - How To Get And How To Use Them
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With the inclusion of Cosmetics in Grow A Garden, you have almost complete freedom to tinker with how your plot of land looks. If you have a theme in mind, chances are that there are enough appropriate items to decorate the surroundings. With each new event, you can purchase or win more and more of these items, each one of which you can find in the designated cosmetics menu.

Of course, given the many trends of Grow A Garden’s mechanics, it’s not just a simple case of being an optional extra that you don’t need to engage with. The rarest of cosmetic items may be required to trigger the abilities of some of the best Grow A Garden pets available. Other, more recent cosmetic items also apply specific Grow A Garden mutations to increase the value of your plants.

How to move Grow A Garden Cosmetics

To access the Grow A Garden Cosmetics menu, open the game and click or tap the icon that resembles a hammer and spanner crossed together. If you have any unseen cosmetic items, they’ll have a number in red next to their icon. You can use the arrow at the top of the inventory screen that appears to expand the number presented at any time. You can find a specific cosmetic by using the search bar in the Cosmetics menu.

Click an item on this menu to place it in your garden in front of you. You can also click/tap on a cosmetic to bring up the controls. You can then shift their position by holding down one of the four main buttons and moving your mouse/finger across the screen. Here is what all the buttons do:

  • Arrow Keys - this moves an item’s placement in your garden.
  • Anti-Clockwise Arrow - flips an item on the vertical axis.
  • Clockwise Arrow - rotates an item horizontally.
  • Inverted Anti-Clockwise Arrow - flips an item on the horizontal axis.
  • Arrow with padlock - implied that it locks the item into place, but this doesn’t work.
  • Box - returns the item to the cosmetic inventory.

The best Grow A Garden Cosmetics

While there are many event Cosmetics, far too many to list at this point, there are a handful that give a separate bonus if you place them in your garden. For example, the Fall Fountain gives the Fall mutation to any of your garden’s plants, something that would only otherwise happen during a Grow A Garden weather event. Others require the corresponding pet to interact with them, like the Hex Serpent using the Hex Circle to sacrifice single-harvest plants for rewards and mutations.

Sadly, many of these items were only available during special events and are unlikely to return for at least a year; some only appear with extremely low odds. If there is a seasonal market, you can attempt to buy them outside of their original events, such as the Fall Market. In addition, one or two of them also require you to either socialize with NPCs with food, as detailed in our Grow A Garden Beginner’s Guide, or enter some limited-time Grow A Garden codes that, as far as we know, still work.

Here are all the Grow A Garden Cosmetics that you can either interact with plants or fruit, or use as another facility of sorts:

  • Hot Spring - the Nihonzaru pet rests in this Cosmetic.
  • Pancake Stack - every 15-30 seconds, it attracts pets to its location.
  • Cooking Pot - the Gorilla Chef uses this Cosmetic.
  • Cooking Kit - used to cook food.
  • Fall Fountain - has a chance to give the Fall mutation to a fruit in your garden.
  • Witch’s Cauldron - the Black Cat naps near this Cosmetic.
  • Hex Circle - plant precisely five single-harvest plants inside of it to trigger the Hex Serpent.
  • Sarcophagus - have alongside a Mummy in your garden to use this pet’s ability.
  • Spell Book + two Halloween Candles - two components to unlocking the Lich Crystal item.
  • Green Bean Chamber - interact to talk to the Green Bean spirit to get the outfit.
  • Mutation Machine Booster - reduces the time of the mutation machine to 50 minutes instead of 60.
  • Pet Incubator - deposit a pet inside to let it grant XP over time. You can feed the machine plants to power it.

Grow A Garden Cosmetic Shop inventory

Aside from the current Grow A Garden event’s selection of themed cosmetics, you can also buy them at the Cosmetic Shop run by Isaac. You can find it next to the Grow A Garden gear shop, and it always has a few items to decorate your garden for sale. These range from boxes containing signs, decorative items, and fence designs. You’ll only see a selection of these at any given time as the shop restocks every four hours. With every restock, the selection alters up to nine cosmetics, as well as nine fences and signs in the separate fences menu. Here are all the current rotations of items that have been made available from the Grow A Garden Cosmetic Shop in recent weeks:

Column HeadColumn HeadColumn Head

  • Keep Out (21%)

Grow A Garden Season Pass Cosmetics

Finally, a bunch of cosmetics are available for those who invest in progressing through the free Season Pass and/or purchase access to the Premium version. You can find out more about how to get them by exploring the next Grow A Garden update, but here is the currently available selection:

Cosmetic NameSeason Pass Level
Zenith Crate
  • Manual Lawnmower (30%)
  • Garden Hose (30%)
  • Flower Bench (19%)
  • Grill (10%)
  • Rotary Clothesline (10%)
  • Skull Chair (1%)
Levels 7, 19, 26, 28 (Premium Only), and 36. (4 from Free pass, 9 from Premium Pass)
Also available in Season Pass Store when in stock for 100 Season Pass points.
Basketball HoopLevel 5 (Free and Premium)
Sun DialLevel 5 (Premium only)
Garden ArborLevel 18 (Free and Premium)
Garden WorkbenchLevel 18 (Premium only)
Bonfire x2Level 35 (Free and Premium)
GazeboLevel 35 (Premium only)

item.title: EA Announces $12 Veteran's Day Pack For Battlefield 6, But Proceeds Won't Be Donated
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

EA has announced a $12 Lead The Way DLC pack to honor Veterans Day in Battlefield 6 and Redsec, designed in collaboration with the National Ranger Association. However, eagle-eyed players have noted fine print in the bundle image that specifies: "no portion of the Lead The Way pack sales is donated."

The DLC pack is named for the "Rangers Lead The Way" slogan and rallying cry, and EA says the pack was created in collaboration with the National Ranger Association to "ensure authenticity." The pack includes the NATO Assault Soldier Skin, Glider 96 Vehicle Skin, a weapon package, a couple of customization items, as well as an XP boost and battle pass tier skip.

While players might have expected that proceeds from the bundle would go back to the non-profit it was created in tandem with, EA instead specified that no portion of sales will be donated. Instead of donating the profits, or even a portion of them, EA made an "independent donation" to the National Ranger Association.

In response to a comment on an Instagram post showcasing the bundle, the National Ranger Association clarified that "EA was very generous in their donation and more to come," however neither the non-profit or EA has put a dollar value on the donation or how it might compare to potential bundle sales. EA has also announced it will be the headline sponsor of the annual Best Ranger Competition.

Many looked to Battlefield competitor Call of Duty as the standard on Veteran's Day fundraising--CoD's Veterans Day packs support the Call of Duty Endowment, a non-profit established by Bobby Kotick that help veterans in the US and UK, with 100% of sales on C.O.D.E. packs going back to the charity.

The Lead The Way pack will launch in Battlefield 6 and battle royale spinoff Redsec on Veteran's Day, November 11, for $12.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ea-announces-12-veterans-day-pack-for-battlefield-6-but-proceeds-wont-be-donated/1100-6536113/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
